name: MAS Boston Society
mission: Tarbiya Department Tarbiya aims at rooting the faith, purifying the soul, expanding and refining knowledge/understanding, developing and refining all aspects of character, boosting commitment, building skills, and instilling the discipline necessary to conduct a successful, fulfilling, meaningful, and balanced life of learning, virtue, commitment, and service of Islam and humanity.
theoryOfChange: Developing God-conscious community servants who can benefit all of society through spiritual development, education, and civic engagement.

grantsData.purpose: MONEY COLLECTED AS PART OF ZAKAT (AN EXPECTATION IN THE MUSLIM FAITH THAT ALL FINANCIALLY STABLE MUSLIMS PAY MONEY TOWARDS HELPING NEEDY INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY) IS GIVEN TO THE ISLAMIC CIRCLE OF NORTH AMERICA (ICNA) RELIEF, WHO THEN DISTRIBUTES THIS MONEY BASED ON AN APPLICATION AND REVIEW PROCESS TO NEEDY INDIVIDUALS.

PAYMENT TO ISB (A RELIGOUS ORGANIZATION) FOR ISB TO PAYDOWN LOAN WHICH WAS USED TO FINANCE THE CONTRUCTION OF THE ISLAMIC SOCIETY OF BOSTON CULTURAL CENTER (THE CENTER). THIS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT BETWEEN MAS BOSTON AND ISB FOR THE CENTER.

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston earns 65/100 due to good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific zakat policies.
The organization reported a program expense ratio of 85.3%, fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised, and 3.2 months of working capital.
MAS Boston provides multiple donation options and giving methods for supporters.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,286,832 and operates programs including Tarbiya, PACE, and Youth Development.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates solid financial efficiency and high program spending, though its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence and a lean liquidity position.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital of 3.2 months is relatively lean for long-term sustainability
Limited public data regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high alignment for Muslim donors by maintaining zakat eligibility and offering programs that instill Islamic values and service to humanity [1][3]. The cause urgency is categorized as religious and cultural, reflecting its role in community identity and youth development [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: MAS Boston allocates 85.3% of its $3,286,832 total revenue toward its core programs, focusing on capacity building through spiritual and character development [2][4]. While the organization maintains high fundraising efficiency, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the local community through spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.3% ensures the majority of funds directly support community services
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.05 per $1 raised
Diverse program offerings ranging from spiritual 'Tarbiya' to civic engagement (PACE)
baseline_narrative.summary: MAS Boston is a non-profit organization dedicated to fostering a balanced life of virtue and service through its Tarbiya, youth development, and public affairs programs [2][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving methods [1][3].

areas_for_improvement.context: While financial efficiency is high, there is <cite id="2">no publicly available beneficiary count</cite> or cost-per-beneficiary data to quantify service delivery impact.

confidence.notes: While the organization is established, the lack of recent tax filings reduces the confidence score.

alignment.explanation: The organization is a high-fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="1">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving critical asnaf categories including the <cite id="1">poor and needy</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can find confidence in the organization's <cite id="4">independent board governance</cite> and its long-standing presence in the Boston community since 2005. Financial transparency is supported by <cite id="4">detailed Form 990 filings</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="2">publish audited financial statements</cite> and formalize its theory of change documentation.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with an <cite id="4">85.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="2">healthy working capital ratio of 3.4 months</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="2">tracking and reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a more granular cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports local Islamic institutions and national partner chapters

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the local community through spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value local community empowerment and want to support Islamic institutional growth in the Boston area through zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through a local community anchor
Care about youth development and spiritual 'Tarbiya' for the next generation
Value high financial efficiency and low fundraising overhead
Support civic engagement and public affairs from a Muslim perspective
giving_considerations: Donations support a mix of direct services and grants to other local Islamic organizations
The organization focuses on capacity building rather than emergency relief
Impact is measured through community presence rather than rigorous academic studies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency relief or those who require RCT-level evidence of behavioral change.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects strong financial inputs and program ratios, but a lack of external evaluation or beneficiary tracking.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAS Boston utilizes a capacity-building model to root faith and develop character through educational and civic programs.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking outcomes would allow MAS Boston to prove that its Tarbiya and youth programs are effectively achieving their spiritual and social goals.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="4">13.4% revenue growth rate</cite> and expanding programs like PACE, the organization has significant capacity to absorb more funding for local services.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">86.0% of its total expenses</cite> toward its programs, exceeding the <cite id="2">peer program ratio median of 80.0%</cite> for religious and cultural organizations.
MAS Boston demonstrates exceptional fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="2">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite> in contribution revenue.
The organization has shown financial resilience with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 13.4%</cite>, indicating growing community support.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Boston's operational strength is rooted in its ability to balance spiritual development with civic engagement. Its 'PACE' (Public Affairs & Civic Engagement) program and 'Tarbiya' initiatives are supported by a robust financial structure where <cite id="4">$2,406,615 comes from direct contributions</cite>, while <cite id="4">$796,962 is generated through program service revenue</cite>. This diversified income stream supports a wide array of services including youth development and the Arkanum program. Furthermore, the organization maintains <cite id="2">3.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing a stable buffer for its ongoing community operations in the Boston area.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim American Society (MAS) Boston serves as a vital community hub dedicated to fostering spiritual growth and civic responsibility within the Greater Boston area. The organization operates with a significant financial footprint, reporting <cite id="4">$3,286,832 in total revenue</cite> according to its most recent comprehensive filings. MAS Boston distinguishes itself through a multi-faceted approach to community development, focusing on its 'Tarbiya' department which aims at <cite id="4">rooting faith and purifying the soul</cite> through structured educational programs. Beyond spiritual instruction, the organization is a significant community actor, managing <cite id="4">$154,532 in total grants</cite> to local partners, including a substantial <cite id="10">$125,000 grant to the Islamic Society of Boston</cite>. This grantmaking capacity underscores its role as an institutional anchor. The organization maintains a lean financial profile, with <cite id="2">fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions are directed toward its core mission of youth development, public affairs, and religious services. As a <cite id="1">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, MAS Boston provides a verified avenue for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations, specifically serving the <cite id="1">fuqara, masakin, and fisabilillah</cite> categories through its community-facing programs.
